retrieve some amniotic fluid. used in prenatal diagnosis of chromosomal
abnormalities and fetal infections, in which a small
amount of amniotic fluid, which contains fetal tissues, is sampled from the
amnion or amniotic sac surrounding a developing fetus, and the fetal DNA is
examined for genetic abnormalities. Developed by Richard Dedrick, this process
can be used for prenatal sex discernment and hence this procedure has legal
restrictions in some countries.
